Thanks

item.title: Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

The value classname is the name of the class that is your application’s entry point.

Recall that the entry point is a class having a method with signature public static void main(String[] args).

After you have set the Main-Class header in the manifest, you then run the JAR file using the following form of the java command:

java -jar JAR-name
The main method of the class specified in the Main-Class header is executed.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @_C_oder [C]oder
item.description:
@_C_oder wrote:

Ok, So i uninstalled everything then re-installed Jdk. I recompiled the client and there were no errors. I then jarred it, and put it into the public folder on Dropbox. I copied the public link and put it where it needs to be in the webclient’s html code. Now its telling me to download the java plug-in (Version 6 Update 30). I installed it and then refreshed the webclient page. Now it says: “Error. Click for details.” Just like what it did last time.

I also found out that when i download the java plug-in (Version 6 Update 30) I can no-longer run my downloadable client that i’ve been working on. It will say “Could not find Main-Class: client. Program will exit.” So i uninstalled the java plug-in (Version 6 Update 30) and now i can open my downloadable client. I just need to find out why my webclient says “Error. Click for details”

If someone could do it for me that would be very helpful.

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote="[C"]oder link=topic=532122.msg3888755#msg3888755 date=1326678175]
So then that means i have the latest version…

Any other thoughts on how to fix it?[/quote]It’s possible you have java 6 still downloaded. Uninstall the java 6 and recompile using java 7 then play with java 7

item.title: Webclient Error
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

major minor is thrown when you are running a batch file with an older java than it was compiled on. This can be easily solved by downloading the latest java and recompiling then run your game.

Read full topic
